title: Pride is claimed to be a sin, yet god himself is the most prideful one

author: Odous
text:
You may be on the way... I had similar thoughts to your last line in the days  or weeks before God saved me, out of the blue, out of the darkness, into His glorious light.

God can't help but be the greatest. It's not a sin for the champions to sing, "We are the champions." It's not wrong for the greatest to be the greatest.

God promotes Himself because it is right and He is the best thing for us.

God orchestrated the fall of Lucifer and the fall of man so His myriad attributes would all be on display, for His great glory and our joy to witness and worship them.

author: thiswaynotthatway
text:
> God orchestrated the fall of Lucifer and the fall of man so His myriad attributes would all be on display, for His great glory and our joy to witness and worship them.

... So he created evil, death and suffering so that he could show off how good he is?

That is horrific. Are you a troll?

author: Odous
text: It's not the only purpose, but it is the ultimate purpose and everything leads back to it. For His people, we believe the suffering and test of our faith will lead to a future where we fellowship directly with God as co-creators

author: thiswaynotthatway
text: You guys believe some fucking revolting shit. Your god is one of the cruelest monsters in all of fiction.

author: Odous
text: i think he'd be cruel if anything were stopping you from choosing right now to believe. You may try to blame God's election for that but it's your own willful choice to not believe

author: thiswaynotthatway
text:
So, on top of everything else you've already said, you're going to add that he's not stopping me from choosing what to believe, ignoring the fact that you don't choose what to believe, he's going to punish me with eternal suffering in a special realm created just for that purpose.

He's inconceivably evil. Who supports that?

Do you think this absolves the earlier monstrosities you mentioned? This is just another on the pile. Imagine that for a moment, torturing people literally forever is just another evil on the pile of this monster you worship. What the fuck man?

author: Odous
text: He's a God of amazing grace toward wretched sinners yet some refuse to turn from their wickedness. The #1 wickedness in the world is rejecting that which is best. He only asks you to turn away from the sewer and drink from a fresh mountain spring.

author: thiswaynotthatway
text:
Mate, you're a Calvinist. Don't you guys specifically believe that our fates are predestined? It's not our choice at all. Your depraved monstrosity of a deity literally made us to torture.

He's so "amazingly full of grace" that he maybe won't torture us for all eternity if we bow low enough and believe the correct unbelievable, unfalsifiable story out of an infinite list of equally unbelievable and unfalsifiable stories.

How much of your humanity do you have to abandon to think this horrific creature is good in any way?

author: Odous
text:
Nope, that's now how calvinism works. We don't know who is elect or not, so what matters in this present moment is if you want to believe or not. If you want to, believe, or humble yourself and cry out to God until He grants you the gift of faith. (He promises to do so.)

If it does indeed turn out that you are not elect, then yes you were made for dishonorable use, but still for God's glory.

Those who see the glory of God wish to glory Him in Heaven (grace) or hell (justice) which they deserve.
